description: The issue arises from a spoofing vulnerability in the Windows Data Protection Application Programming Interface (DPAPI) that is exploitable at the network level. An attacker can conduct a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack to intercept and potentially modify communications between a domain controller and a target machine. Successful exploitation requires a user to engage in actions that enable this attack, underscoring the high complexity required for the attacker to manipulate network traffic effectively. This vulnerability affects several build numbers, specifically Windows versions including 10.0.10240.20345, 10.0.22000.2652, and 10.0.19041.3803, among others. Associated KB articles that provide patches for this issue are KB-5033379, KB-5033375, KB-5033372, and KB-5033369.
